sentence.text: blood vessel development mutations have been found to be responsible for Tricho-Dento-Osseous (TDO) syndrome, characterized by kinky hair, thin-pitted enamel and increased bone density.

Here we show that the blood vessel development mutation (c.533â€‰A>G; Q178R) attenuates osteogenic potential and senescence of bone mesenchymal stem cells (BMSCs) isolated from a tryptophan catabolic process to kynurenine patient, providing a molecular explanation for abnormal increased bone density.
